member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.HumidityThermostat._RegulationHumidity
member.summary: Reports the mean (averaged) humidity reading of all internal and remote humidity sensors set to "Use", in whole numbers. Humidity sensors are manually set to Use, Omit, or Outdoor via the setup menus on the thermostat.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.HumidityThermostat._LocalHumidity
member.summary: Reports the relative humidity reading of the built-in humidity sensor in whole numbers. The internal humidity sensor reading is reported regardless of the Use or Omit designation.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.HumidityThermostat._Remote1Humidity
member.summary: Reports the humidity reading of the Remote 1 humidity sensor in whole numbers. The Remote 1 humidity reading is reported regardless of the Use/Omit/OD designation.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.HumidityThermostat._Remote2Humidity
member.summary: Reports the humidity reading of the Remote 2 humidity sensor in whole numbers. The Remote 2 humidity reading is reported regardless of the Use/Omit/OD designation.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.HumidityThermostat._Remote3Humidity
member.summary: Reports the humidity reading of the Remote 3 humidity sensor in whole numbers. The Remote 3 humidity reading is reported regardless of the Use/Omit/OD designation.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.HumidityThermostat._OutdoorHumidity
member.summary: Reports the humidity reading of any humidity sensor set to "OD" (Outdoor) in whole numbers. If more than one humidity sensor is set to OD, this is the mean outdoor humidity. Humidity sensors are manually set to Use, Omit, or Outdoor via the setup menus on the thermostat.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.HumidityThermostat._DispHumidityModePage
member.summary: Indicates that the Humidity View page has been enabled for display on the thermostat LCD. The output remains true for as long as the page is enabled. The Humidity View Page displays the relative humidity and setpoint values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.HumidityThermostat.HumiditySetpointPlus
member.summary: Raises the humidity regulating setpoint. Continuing to assert the up or down inputs at the limits of the setpoint will not affect the setpoint. That is, the setpoint will hold at its maximum or minimum setting.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.HumidityThermostat.HumiditySetpointMinus
member.summary: Lowers the humidity regulating setpoint. Continuing to assert the up or down inputs at the limits of the setpoint will not affect the setpoint. That is, the setpoint will hold at its maximum or minimum setting.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.HumidityThermostat.IndoorHumidityInput
member.summary: Receives the indoor relative humidity from a sensor that is not connected to the thermostat, for display on the Main page of the thermostat LCD (CHV-TSTAT only). This value is ignored if a humidity sensor (CHV-RTHS) is connected to the CHV-TSTAT.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.HumidityThermostat.OutdoorHumidityInput
member.summary: Receives the outdoor relative humidity from a sensor that is not connected to the thermostat, for display on the Outdoor page of the thermostat LCD. This value is ignored if an outdoor humidity sensor (CHV-RTHS) is connected to the thermostat.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.Thermostat.AutoDeadbandFeedback
member.summary:
Reports the auto deadband value selected via the "db" option in the Setup menu, where 1d = 0.1 degrees. In dual-setpoint auto mode, this value is the minimum separation between heat and cool setpoints, which prevents the system from toggling back and forth due to overshoot. In single-setpoint auto mode, this value sets the hysteresis used when changing from heat to cool. For example, if the setpoint is 70°F with auto deadband of 2 degrees, the temperature would have to rise to 72°F before running cool, and 68°F before running heat.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.Thermostat.OutdoorTemperatureFeedback
member.summary:
Sends the current outdoor temperature to the thermostat. This input should only be used for heatpump/dual fuel balance point systems, not heat/cool system types. The value should be sent in tenths of a degree (1d = 0.1 degrees) based on the current temperature scale (Fahrenheit or Celsius). For example, if the outdoor temperature is 45.3°F, the value should be 453.
The event will trigger with and .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.Thermostat.RegulationTemperatureFeedback
member.summary:
Reports displayed temperature, which can be the Local temperature or the Remote 1 temperature, or the average of Local and Remote 1, based on the option selected in the Setup menu (Local = i; Remote 1 = r; Average = ir).
The event will trigger with and .

member.summary: Reports the local temperature reported by the Local sensor. Only enabled when EnableSensorOutputs is enabled. This property is not supported by "DinThstat".

member.summary:

member.summary: Sends the current outdoor temperature to the thermostat. This input should only be used for heatpump/dual fuel balance point systems, not heat/cool system types. The value should be sent in tenths of a degree (1d = 0.1 degrees) based on the current temperature scale (Fahrenheit or Celsius). For example, if the outdoor temperature is 45.3°F, the value should be 453d.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._remotePageOneUpButtonLabel
member.summary: Sends text label for display next to the Remote Function Button 1 (Up pushbutton) on Remote Page 1 of the thermostat LCD. The thermostat LCD provides two Remote pages in which the Up and Down pushbuttons operate as remote function buttons. In this mode the buttons can trigger non-HVAC functions such as AV control, lighting, or alarm activation.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._GlobalPress
member.summary: Briefly pulses high whenever the Send button of the Global Update page is pressed. This signal can be tied to logic in the program to trigger functions such as global updates of temperature or humidity values.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._OfflineHold
member.summary: Indicates that the thermostat has been taken offline. In this mode, the thermostat is "on hold" and data flows one way, from the thermostat to Cresnet. All Cresnet commands to the thermostat are blocked except for the Hold Off command. While the thermostat is "on hold" it buffers all setpoint and mode changes (except for up/down inputs). The setpoints and mode inputs will take effect immediately when the hold is released. Remains true for as long as the thermostat is offline.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._remotePageOneUpButton
member.summary: Indicates that Remote Function Button 1 (Up pushbutton) has been pressed on Remote Page 1 of the thermostat LCD. The output remains true for as long as the button is pressed. The thermostat LCD provides two Remote pages in which the Up and Down pushbuttons operate as remote function buttons. In this mode the buttons can trigger non-HVAC "remote" functions such as AV control, lighting, or alarm activation.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._remotePageOneDownButton
member.summary: Indicates that Remote Function Button 2 (Down pushbutton) has been pressed on Remote Page 1 of the thermostat LCD. The output remains true for as long as the button is pressed. The thermostat LCD provides two Remote pages in which the Up and Down pushbuttons operate as remote function buttons. In this mode the buttons can trigger non-HVAC "remote" functions such as AV control, lighting, or alarm activation.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._DualSetpointsAutoMode
member.summary: Indicates that dual-point auto mode has been enabled. The output remains true for as long as the mode is enabled. Auto mode can be enabled or disabled from the Setup menu.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._NoAutoMode
member.summary: Indicates that auto mode has been disabled. The output remains true for as long as auto mode is off. Auto mode can be enabled or disabled from the Setup menu.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._WideRangeCool
member.summary: Indicates that wide range cool mode has been enabled. The output remains true for as long as the mode is enabled. Wide range cool extends the cool setpoint range to the full auto range of 38° to 99°F, or 3° to 37°C. This is suitable for wine cellars or other colder chilling processes.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._RunFanHeatCalls
member.summary: Indicates that Run Fan in Heat Calls has been enabled. The output remains true for as long as the mode is enabled. Run Fan in Heat Calls is a device setting that activates the fan output with W1/W2 heat calls. Does not enable operation on slab systems on the slab (W1) call.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._ColdWeatherComp

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._RevSmodeDir
member.summary: Indicates the direction of system mode toggling in response to up/down button presses. The output goes true when the Setup option for "Reverse System Mode Direction" is set to "Y". In this mode, the UP button moves the mode select box to the right instead of to the left.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._UseLocalTemp
member.summary: Event ID for the base event for reporting the designator assigned to the local (internal) sensors. The CHV-TSTAT provides one internal temperature sensor; the CHV-THSTAT provides internal sensors for temperature and humidity. Each sensor must be designated as Use or Omit. Readings from local and remote sensors that have the same designator are averaged together. Thus two temperature sensors set to Use are averaged for the air temperature control, while two humidity sensors set to Use are averaged to determine the humidity. A sensor designated as "Omit" signifies that the reading will not be included in such averaging.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._OmitLocalTemp
member.summary: The CHV-TSTAT provides one internal temperature sensor; the CHV-THSTAT provides internal sensors for temperature and humidity. Each sensor must be designated as Use or Omit. Readings from local and remote sensors that have the same designator are averaged together. Thus two temperature sensors set to Use are averaged for the air temperature control, while two humidity sensors set to Use are averaged to determine the humidity. A sensor designated as "Omit" signifies that the reading will not be included in such averaging.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._UseRem1Temp
member.summary: Reports the designator assigned to the remote sensors. The CHV-TSTAT and CHV-THSTAT provide two remote channels. Each channel supports two sensors, for a maximum of four remote sensors. Crestron manufacturers three sensor models: CHV-RTS: temperature sensor CHV-RTHS: dual temperature/humidity sensor CHV-RSS: slab sensor Each sensor must be designated as Use, Omit, OD (Outdoor) or Slab. Readings from local and remote sensors that have the same designator are averaged together. Thus two sensors set to Use are averaged for the air temperature control, while two OD readings are averaged to determine the outdoor temperature, and two Slab readings are averaged for the floor temperature. A sensor designated as "Omit" signifies that the reading will not be included in such averaging.

member.summary: Reports the LCD screen contrast.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._TempDispOffset
member.summary: Reports the temperature offset in tenths of a degree. The offset is the number of degrees added or subtracted from the actual sensed temperature. The scale (Fahrenheit or Celsius) is based on the current setting in the unit. Values are as follows: Fahrenheit: -60 to +60 (-6˚ to +6˚F) Celsius: -30 to +30 (-3˚ to +3˚C) Half degrees Celsius mode: -35 to +35 (-3.5˚to +3.5˚C) This temperature offset changes the actual regulated temperature, not just the displayed temperature. The offset is set to "0" as shipped from the factory.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat._SlabTemp
member.summary: Reports the temperature reading of any remote sensor set to "Slab", in tenths of a degree. The scale (Fahrenheit or Celsius) is based on the current setting in the unit. If more than one sensor is set to "Slab", this is the mean slab temperature. Sensors are set to Use, Omit, OD (Outdoor) or Slab via the setup menus on the thermostat.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat.MsgField
member.summary: Sends text string to the Messages page of the thermostat LCD. Displayed text is limited to approximately 20 characters per line (including spaces) to a maximum of four lines. The thermostat supports word wrap and auto-hyphenation within the 20 characters/spaces per line maximum. (Carriage returns will force a line change.)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat.RemotePageOneUpButtonLabel
member.summary: Sends text label for display next to the Up button on Remote Page one of the thermostat LCD. The thermostat LCD provides two Remote pages in which the Up and Down pushbuttons operate as remote function buttons. In this mode the buttons can trigger non-HVAC functions such as AV control, lighting, or alarm activation.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat.GlobalPress
member.summary: Briefly pulses whenever the Send button of the Global Update page is pressed. This signal can be tied to logic in the program to trigger functions such as global updates of temperature or humidity values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat.OfflineHold
member.summary: Indicates that the thermostat has been taken offline. In this mode, the thermostat is "on hold" and data flows one way, from the thermostat to Cresnet. All Cresnet commands to the thermostat are blocked except for the Hold Off command. While the thermostat is "on hold" it buffers all setpoint and mode changes (except for up/down inputs). The setpoints and mode inputs will take effect immediately when the hold is released. Remains true for as long as the thermostat is offline.

The thermostat LCD provides two Remote pages in which the Up and Down pushbuttons operate as remote function buttons. In this mode the buttons can trigger non-HVAC "remote" functions such as AV control, lighting, or alarm activation.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat.UseLocalTemperature
member.summary: Reports if temperature is assigned to the local (internal) sensors. The CHV-TSTAT provides one internal temperature sensor; the CHV-THSTAT provides internal sensors for temperature and humidity. Each sensor must be designated as Use or Omit. Readings from local and remote sensors that have the same designator are averaged together. Thus two temperature sensors set to Use are averaged for the air temperature control, while two humidity sensors set to Use are averaged to determine the humidity. A sensor designated as "Omit" signifies that the reading will not be included in such averaging.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat.OmitLocalTemperature
member.summary: Reports if temperature is assigned to the local (internal) sensors. The CHV-TSTAT provides one internal temperature sensor; the CHV-THSTAT provides internal sensors for temperature and humidity. Each sensor must be designated as Use or Omit. Readings from local and remote sensors that have the same designator are averaged together. Thus two temperature sensors set to Use are averaged for the air temperature control, while two humidity sensors set to Use are averaged to determine the humidity. A sensor designated as "Omit" signifies that the reading will not be included in such averaging.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat.HeatAnticipator
member.summary: Reports the heat anticipator values, from 1 to 6. Prevents overshooting the set temperature. A lower number signifies more frequent cycles and faster response (tighter regulation), while a higher number signifies less frequent cycles and slower response (looser regulation).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat.CoolAnticipator
member.summary: Reports the cool anticipator values, from 1 to 6. Prevents overshooting the set temperature. A lower number signifies more frequent cycles and faster response (tighter regulation), while a higher number signifies less frequent cycles and slower response (looser regulation).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat.LCDContrast
member.summary: Reports the LCD screen contrast. Values range from 1 (lightest) to 10 (darkest).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.CresnetThermostat.TemperatureDispOffset
member.summary: Reports the temperature offset in tenths of a degree. The offset is the number of degrees added or subtracted from the actual sensed temperature. The scale (Fahrenheit or Celsius) is based on the current setting in the unit. Values are as follows: Fahrenheit: -60 to +60 (-6˚ to +6˚F) Celsius: -30 to +30 (-3˚ to +3˚C) Half degrees Celsius mode: -35 to +35 (-3.5˚to +3.5˚C) This temperature offset changes the actual regulated temperature, not just the displayed temperature. The offset is set to "0" as shipped from the factory.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan._InterstageDifferential
member.summary: Reports the interstage differential in tenths of a degree. This is the proportional temperature error to trigger the second (Auxiliary) stage. The scale (Fahrenheit or Celsius) is based on the current setting in the unit. Values range from 0.5 to 3.0 (5° to 30°F); or 0.25 to 2.0 (3° to 20°C).

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan._HPBalancePoint
member.summary: Reports the heat pump balance point in tenths of a degree. The scale (Fahrenheit or Celsius) is based on the current setting in the unit. Values range from 0 to 900 (0?to 90?F); or -180 to +320 (-18?to 32?C). The heat pump balance point is the outdoor temperature below which heat pump operation is locked out, and auxiliary heat runs in place of it.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan._AUXBalancePoint
member.summary: Reports the aux balance point in tenths of a degree. The scale (Fahrenheit or Celsius) is based on the current setting in the unit. Values range from 0 to 900 (0?to 90?F); or -180 to +320 (-18?to 32?C). The auxiliary balance point is the outdoor temperature above which auxiliary heat is locked out.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan._SlabRegulation
member.summary: Reports the slab temperature regulation value. Values range from 1 to 6. A lower number signifies less frequent cycles and slower response (looser regulation), while a higher number signifies more frequent cycles and faster response (tighter regulation).

member.summary: Indicates that the Humidity Mode page has been enabled for display on the thermostat LCD. The output remains true for as long as the page is enabled. The Humidity Mode page allows the user to enable or disable the humidifier.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.DispHumidityViewPage
member.summary: Indicates that the Humidity View page has been enabled for display on the thermostat LCD. The output remains true for as long as the page is enabled. The Humidity View Page displays the relative humidity and setpoint values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.HumidifierEnable
member.summary: Enables the humidifier.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.HumidifierEnableFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the humidifier is enabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.HumidifierOff
member.summary: Turns off the humidifier.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.HumidifierOffFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the humidifier is off.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.HumidityCallFeedbacks
member.summary: Returns a collection of components that indicate when the system is calling for humidity.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.HumiditySetpoint
member.summary: Sets the humidity regulating setpoint in whole numbers. Valid values range from 5 to 90. Out of range values are ignored.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.HumiditySetpointFeedback
member.summary: Reports the humidity regulating setpoint.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.HumiditySetpointMinus
member.summary: Lowers the humidity regulating setpoint. Continuing to assert the up or down inputs at the limits of the setpoint will not affect the setpoint. That is, the setpoint will hold at its maximum or minimum setting.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.HumiditySetpointPlus
member.summary: Raises the humidity regulating setpoint. Continuing to assert the up or down inputs at the limits of the setpoint will not affect the setpoint. That is, the setpoint will hold at its maximum or minimum setting.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.IndoorHumidityInput
member.summary: Receives the indoor relative humidity from a sensor that is not connected to the thermostat, for display on the Main page of the thermostat LCD (CHV-TSTAT only). This value is ignored if a humidity sensor (CHV-RTHS) is connected to the CHV-TSTAT.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.LocalHumidity
member.summary: Reports the relative humidity reading of the built-in humidity sensor (CHV-THSTAT only) in whole numbers. The internal humidity sensor reading is reported regardless of the Use or Omit designation.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.LocalHumInvalid
member.summary: Indicates that the corresponding when remote humidity sensor isn't reporting valid data. The output remains true for as long as the sensor source doesn't have valid data. This can indicate a problem with the sensor, or the sensor being absent.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.MainScrnObHumidity
member.summary: Reports the reading that will be displayed under the current temperature on the Main page of the thermostat LCD.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.SingleSpeedFan.ODHumInvalid
member.summary: Indicates that the corresponding when remote humidity sensor isn't reporting valid data. The output remains true for as long as the sensor source doesn't have valid data. This can indicate a problem with the sensor, or the sensor being absent.

member.summary: Reports the designator assigned to the remote sensors.

member.summary: Property returns object. Property to set the minimum setpoints allowed to display and report by the Deseo. Minimum analog values are as follows: Heat setpoint: 380 (38 F) or 30 (3 C). Cool setpoint: 590 (59 F) or 150 (15 C). Reported in tenths of a degree.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.BasalteDeseo.MaximumSetpoint
member.summary: Property returns object. Property to set the maximum setpoints allowed to display and report by the Deseo. Reported in tenths of a degree. Maximum analog values are as follows: Heat setpoint: 890 (89 F) or 320 (32 C). Cool setpoint: 990 (99 F) or 370 (37 C).

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.DinThstat
member.summary:
Cresnet Thermostat with two parts, first part is DIN Head Unit which is installed at the HVAC unit and the second part is UI and may also contain one Temperature Sensor where is it not possible to land the sensors directly on the head unit. The login on how to control HVAC is contained in the head unit.
This class will trigger , , and events.

Reports the current Humidistat setpoint value in 1% RH ticks. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.DinThstat.RegulationHumidityFeedback
member.summary:
Reports the current value of the humidistat regulation humidity (as would be displayed on the thermostat UI, which can be an average of multiple sensors).
The event will trigger with and value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.DinThstat.FloorTemperatureFeedback
member.summary:
Reports the current floor temperature in tenths of current unit. This is like the “regulation” values from other slots, which can be an average of more than one floor sensor. However, it is reported for any floor radiant system configuration, even if the type does not control the floor temperature.
The event will trigger with and .

Indicates that if device does not have a valid sensor source for space (air) temperature regulation. true = no valid sensor present; false = valid sensor present

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.DinThstat.InvalidFloorTemperatureFeedback

The event will trigger with object.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.DinThstat.InvalidOutdoorTemperatureFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report when device requires outdoor temperature and no valid source is present. Outdoor temperature is required in heat pump systems for proper balance point operation. Device may operate sub-optimally with timing-based safeguards to ensure freeze out protection. Note for balance point operation, outdoor temperature may be sourced from control system via . true = no valid sensor present; false = valid sensor present
The event will trigger with object.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.RFThermostat.SensorConfigurationFeedback
member.summary: 16-bit analog value that reports sensor configuration information, as follows: bits 15 and 14: 2-bit version code, currently 00 bits 13 and 12: Reserved bit 11: RS2 temperature data valid (1) or invalid (0) bit 10: RS1 temperature data valid (1) or invalid (0) bit 9: Local temperature valid (1) or invalid (0) bit 8: RS2 sensor type digital (0) or analog/NTC (1) bit 7: RS1 sensor type digital (0) or analog/NTC (1) bit 6: Local sensor type digital (0) or analog/NTC (1) bits 5 and 4: RS2 usage code (see below) bits 3 and 2: RS1 usage code bits 1 and 0: Local usage code Usage code 00: Not used/averaged 01: For regulation temperature 10: For outdoor temperature 11: For specific sensing (i.e., FCU changeover)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.RFThermostat.SystemConfigurationFeedback
member.summary: For internal Crestron use only.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.RFThermostat.HoldMode
member.summary: Sets the hold mode as follows: 1d = Hold mode ON 2d = Hold mode OFF (Run mode ON) When hold mode is active, the setpoint can be manually adjusted, either locally or via the Simpl#Pro program. All scheduled setpoints are ignored until the unit is taken out of hold mode. When the hold state changes from Hold (1d) to Run (2d), the unit will recall the last scheduled setpoint.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.RFThermostat.SystemMode
member.summary: Sets the system mode, as follows: When the system mode changes the unit will recall the last scheduled setpoint for that new mode. This output should be connected to the HoldMode input; otherwise the output it will not track the value of HoldMode.

member.summary: Indicates that the low fan speed has been enabled (via the Setup screens). The output remains true for as long as the fan speed is enabled. Note that this output only indicates that the unit has been configured to support the corresponding fan speed; it does not indicate whether or not the unit is actively in that mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.ChvTstatexFcu.FanSpeedMediumEnabledFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the medium fan speed has been enabled (via the Setup screens). The output remains true for as long as the fan speed is enabled. Note that this output only indicates that the unit has been configured to support the corresponding fan speed; it does not indicate whether or not the unit is actively in that mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.ChvTstatexFcu.FanCallHighFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the 3-speed fan is running at high speed. The output remains true for as long as the fan is running at high speed.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.ChvTstatexFcu.FanCallMedFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the 3-speed fan is running at medium speed. The output remains true for as long as the fan is running at medium speed.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Thermostats.ChvTstatexFcu.FanCallLowFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the 3-speed fan is running at low speed. The output remains true for as long as the fan is running at low speed.
